timeline.bodyText: will it be possible to use the optional for alias?
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: Added alias to support ModuleID interface. I think we need to remove alias from this class since it doesn't affect the equality of the two separate imports. equal implementation ignores it here.
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText: What would be the consequence if we try to depend on the node kind instance of code action node kind?
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: I tried to implement it that way, issue is we cannot distinguish nodes in different contexts with node syntax-kind alone. For instance when you have a function definition syntax-kind, there's no clue whether it is a resource-function or a top-level function.
replies.author: rasika

replies.bodyText: This is a code movement of what we introduced for detecting unformatted sources. First part checks whether it is within start segment of the node. isWithinStartSegment has separate calculations base on the node-type. Some checks are for isWithinBody. We can merge only variables, imports and assignments. Others are bit different. Will try to simplify this.
